intro: Acleisanthes parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved acleisanthes, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Acleisanthes parvifolia is adapted to arid environments and is known for its ability to bloom during the cooler months.
